intro: Dimorphotheca leptocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, typical of the family. It grows in coastal and sandy environments, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions.
